Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the extent to which China and Russia have never voted with the US on any sanctions on Iran in the past.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that China and Russia have actually endorsed sanctions against Iran at least eight times before the 2015 nuclear deal.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it contradicts the evidence of previous Security Council resolutions where Russia and China approved sanctions against Iran.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that China and Russia have never supported any sanctions on Iran in the past.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider the alternative explanation that efforts to sanction Iran may have been abandoned before a formal vote due to the veto power of any one nation on the UN Security Council.
